sentences.english: This is the building whose windows were all painted green.
sentences.chinese: 这就是窗户都漆成绿色的那幢楼。

sentences.english: The new owner transformed the old house into a showplace.
sentences.chinese: 新主人把那幢旧房子装修得富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: It is in the DX community, Room 306, No.2 building.
Look at that building across the street from us.
sentences.chinese: 你看看我们对面街上的那幢高楼。

sentences.english: There are two vacant apartments in the building where I live.
sentences.chinese: 我住的那幢楼里还有两间公寓空着。

sentences.english: There is an emergency gate on each side of the building.
sentences.chinese: 幢楼的两侧各有两个安全门。

sentences.english: That’s my house on the left.
sentences.chinese: 左边的那幢就是我的房子。

sentences.english: He decided to sell the house, all of whose windows face south.
sentences.chinese: 他决定卖掉所有窗户朝南的那幢房子。

sentences.english: They had a comfortable western-style house in the suburbs of Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他们在东京郊区有幢舒服的西洋式房屋。

sentences.english: He highballed us and we dashed into the building.
sentences.chinese: 他向我们发出信号后，我们就冲进了那幢大楼。

sentences.english: People say ghosts haunt that old house .
sentences.chinese: 人们说鬼常出没于那幢古老的房子。

sentences.english: I saw flames advancing out of that building.
sentences.chinese: 我看到火苗从那幢楼里窜出来。

sentences.english: The old couple sell that large house and move into a small bungalow.
sentences.chinese: 老两口卖掉了那幢大房子，搬进了小平房。

sentences.english: The thieves had forced an entry into the building.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼强行进入了那幢建筑物。

sentences.english: They have torn off the old building.
sentences.chinese: 他们已拆毁了那幢旧建筑。

sentences.english: The building being built is our library.
sentences.chinese: 正在建的那幢楼是我们的图书馆。

definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
